segment.source: Test an update
segment.target: Test an update

segment.source: Test an update
segment.target: Test an update

segment.source: Test an update
segment.target: Test an update

segment.source: Update testing should begin when your first image is being developed.
segment.target: Update testing should begin when your first image is being developed.

segment.source: Test that your drivers, preloaded apps, and other content can be updated throughout the process.
segment.target: Test that your drivers, preloaded apps, and other content can be updated throughout the process.

segment.source: During the phase when you are building test images, you should perform local testing of updates, run the compatibility tests before and after the update, and look for the same results.
segment.target: During the phase when you are building test images, you should perform local testing of updates, run the compatibility tests before and after the update, and look for the same results.

segment.source: This is a time when you can more easily test a full breadth of phone features with automation and discover update issues early.
segment.target: This is a time when you can more easily test a full breadth of phone features with automation and discover update issues early.

segment.source: Do not wait until you are nearing manufacturing and retail device testing.
segment.target: Do not wait until you are nearing manufacturing and retail device testing.

segment.source: Over the Air (OTA) updates can only be tested on retail device, which is more difficult to do because of the higher security on a retail device.
segment.target: Over the Air (OTA) updates can only be tested on retail device, which is more difficult to do because of the higher security on a retail device.

segment.source: Therefore, it is important that you perform deep functional testing on the test images, and focus your testing on retail phones to ensure that the OTA update is successful by following the guidance in the Network testing of updates section.
segment.target: Therefore, it is important that you perform deep functional testing on the test images, and focus your testing on retail phones to ensure that the OTA update is successful by following the guidance in the Network testing of updates section.

segment.source: OEMs must ensure the quality of an OEM update by fully testing the update before submitting it to Microsoft.
segment.target: OEMs must ensure the quality of an OEM update by fully testing the update before submitting it to Microsoft.

segment.source: As a minimum, the OEM must do the following.
segment.target: As a minimum, the OEM must do the following.

segment.source: Verify that the packages that are updated do not contain any test certificates when testing a retail image.
segment.target: Verify that the packages that are updated do not contain any test certificates when testing a retail image.

segment.source: Verify that the firmware revision numbers have changed properly by navigating to SettingsSystemabout on the device.
segment.target: Verify that the firmware revision numbers have changed properly by navigating to SettingsSystemabout on the device.

segment.source: For more info about versioning information, see Update requirements.
segment.target: For more info about versioning information, see Update requirements.

segment.source: Verify that the OEM update package works as designed.
segment.target: Verify that the OEM update package works as designed.

segment.source: Test the update on device that have user data to make sure that their data is preserved.
segment.target: Test the update on device that have user data to make sure that their data is preserved.

segment.source: The following are some examples of tests that you can perform to ensure that user data has not been modified after an update.
segment.target: The following are some examples of tests that you can perform to ensure that user data has not been modified after an update.

segment.source: All user settings are the same.
segment.target: All user settings are the same.

segment.source: Start screen tiles have the same position and size.
segment.target: Start screen tiles have the same position and size.

segment.source: User data is still on the device (pictures, apps, SMS history, music files, video files, etc.)
segment.target: User data is still on the device (pictures, apps, SMS history, music files, video files, etc.)

segment.source: Local testing of updates
segment.target: Local testing of updates

segment.source: Before you submit the update, test it locally.
segment.target: Before you submit the update, test it locally.

segment.source: On a PC that you will use during the tests, perform the following steps:
segment.target: On a PC that you will use during the tests, perform the following steps:

segment.source: Deploy the updated test packages to the device.
segment.target: Deploy the updated test packages to the device.

segment.source: You can receive the update packages from the update that has already been approved for testing by using the Get-SignedFirmwareSubmission cmdlet.
segment.target: You can receive the update packages from the update that has already been approved for testing by using the Get-SignedFirmwareSubmission cmdlet.

segment.source: Verify that the update was successful and that it had no unintentional effects on the behavior of the device.
segment.target: Verify that the update was successful and that it had no unintentional effects on the behavior of the device.

segment.source: Network testing of updates
segment.target: Network testing of updates

segment.source: To prepare to receive an update from the Microsoft test update server, complete the following steps.
segment.target: To prepare to receive an update from the Microsoft test update server, complete the following steps.

segment.source: Obtain a test update provisioning package from Microsoft after you have signed up to submit requests for firmware and update submissions.
segment.target: Obtain a test update provisioning package from Microsoft after you have signed up to submit requests for firmware and update submissions.

segment.source: Apply the provisioning package to the device by using IUTool.exe.
segment.target: Apply the provisioning package to the device by using IUTool.exe.

segment.source: Establish a connection to a cellular or Wi-Fi network with the device and attach the device to a charger.
segment.target: Establish a connection to a cellular or Wi-Fi network with the device and attach the device to a charger.

segment.source: Note
segment.target: Note

segment.source: We recommend using Wi-Fi to download the update so that you do not run into any constraints with your mobile operator when testing.
segment.target: We recommend using Wi-Fi to download the update so that you do not run into any constraints with your mobile operator when testing.

segment.source: Mobile operators can specify update download size limits when using their cellular data connection.
segment.target: Mobile operators can specify update download size limits when using their cellular data connection.

segment.source: Initiate the update process via SettingsUpdate & recoveryPhone update.
segment.target: Initiate the update process via SettingsUpdate & recoveryPhone update.

segment.source: When the updates are presented, follow the prompts and complete the update process.
segment.target: When the updates are presented, follow the prompts and complete the update process.

segment.source: Verify that the update was successful and that it had no unintentional effects on the behavior of the device.
segment.target: Verify that the update was successful and that it had no unintentional effects on the behavior of the device.

segment.source: Test cases for features after an update
segment.target: Test cases for features after an update

segment.source: Wi-Fi
segment.target: Wi-Fi

segment.source: Prerequisites: None
segment.target: Prerequisites: None

segment.source: Test steps:
segment.target: Test steps:

segment.source: In the App list, tap SettingsNetwork wirelessWi-Fi.
segment.target: In the App list, tap SettingsNetwork wirelessWi-Fi.

segment.source: Select a secured wireless network.
segment.target: Select a secured wireless network.

segment.source: Sign in with the appropriate credentials.
segment.target: Sign in with the appropriate credentials.

segment.source: Verify that the status to the network is shown as “Connected.”
segment.target: Verify that the status to the network is shown as “Connected.”

segment.source: Verify that the Wi-Fi icon at the top of the device appears as expected.
segment.target: Verify that the Wi-Fi icon at the top of the device appears as expected.

segment.source: Note
segment.target: Note

segment.source: The icon should flash while the device is connecting and remain solid after the phone is connected.
segment.target: The icon should flash while the device is connecting and remain solid after the phone is connected.

segment.source: The icon may disappear for a few seconds after the device is connected.
segment.target: The icon may disappear for a few seconds after the device is connected.

segment.source: The icon can be displayed again by tapping the middle of the top screen.
segment.target: The icon can be displayed again by tapping the middle of the top screen.

segment.source: Tap Start, and then tap Internet Explorer.
segment.target: Tap Start, and then tap Internet Explorer.

segment.source: Note
segment.target: Note

segment.source: When the browser is launched for the first time, a dialog will pop up asking to “Use the recommended settings?”
segment.target: When the browser is launched for the first time, a dialog will pop up asking to “Use the recommended settings?”

segment.source: Tap the Recommended button.
segment.target: Tap the Recommended button.

segment.source: Tap the address bar and enter a website URL.
segment.target: Tap the address bar and enter a website URL.

segment.source: Tap the enter key on the virtual keyboard to go to the site.
segment.target: Tap the enter key on the virtual keyboard to go to the site.

segment.source: Verify that the page is loaded.
segment.target: Verify that the page is loaded.

segment.source: Tap Start to return to the Start screen, and then in the App list, tap SettingsNetwork wirelessWi-Fi.
segment.target: Tap Start to return to the Start screen, and then in the App list, tap SettingsNetwork wirelessWi-Fi.

segment.source: Select and connect to an unsecured wireless network.
segment.target: Select and connect to an unsecured wireless network.

segment.source: Press Start to return to the Start screen, and then tap Internet Explorer.
segment.target: Press Start to return to the Start screen, and then tap Internet Explorer.

segment.source: Tap the address bar and enter a different website URL.
segment.target: Tap the address bar and enter a different website URL.

segment.source: Verify that the page is loaded properly.
segment.target: Verify that the page is loaded properly.

segment.source: Tap Start to return to the Start screen, and in the App list, tap SettingsNetwork wirelessWi-Fimanage.
segment.target: Tap Start to return to the Start screen, and in the App list, tap SettingsNetwork wirelessWi-Fimanage.

segment.source: Verify that both of the network names are present in the list of Known Networks.
segment.target: Verify that both of the network names are present in the list of Known Networks.

segment.source: Tap and hold Open network.
segment.target: Tap and hold Open network.

segment.source: Tap delete.
segment.target: Tap delete.

segment.source: Verify that the device connects to the secured network automatically from Step 2.
segment.target: Verify that the device connects to the secured network automatically from Step 2.

segment.source: Maps
segment.target: Maps

segment.source: Prerequisites: None
segment.target: Prerequisites: None

segment.source: Test steps:
segment.target: Test steps:

segment.source: In the App list, tap Maps.
segment.target: In the App list, tap Maps.

segment.source: Verify that the location prompt appears when Maps is launched for the first time.
segment.target: Verify that the location prompt appears when Maps is launched for the first time.

segment.source: Tap Allow to enable location awareness.
segment.target: Tap Allow to enable location awareness.

segment.source: The app will load the current location.
segment.target: The app will load the current location.

segment.source: When Maps is completely loaded, verify the following.
segment.target: When Maps is completely loaded, verify the following.

segment.source: The map is zoomed in so that roads in the local area are visible.
segment.target: The map is zoomed in so that roads in the local area are visible.

segment.source: The Me icon (diamond or circle shaped) is placed at the phone location.
segment.target: The Me icon (diamond or circle shaped) is placed at the phone location.

segment.source: The circle in the center of the Me icon should match the color of the phone theme.
segment.target: The circle in the center of the Me icon should match the color of the phone theme.

segment.source: Verify that the Maps app bar is displayed at the bottom with the following four buttons.
segment.target: Verify that the Maps app bar is displayed at the bottom with the following four buttons.

segment.source: Scout (the button is a row of buildings).
segment.target: Scout (the button is a row of buildings).

segment.source: Directions (the button is an arrow).
segment.target: Directions (the button is an arrow).

segment.source: Me (the button is a circle inside a circle).
segment.target: Me (the button is a circle inside a circle).

segment.source: Search (the button is a magnifying glass).
segment.target: Search (the button is a magnifying glass).

segment.source: Note
segment.target: Note

segment.source: For some of the images, Scout is not available.
segment.target: For some of the images, Scout is not available.

segment.source: Pan the map away from the device location and then tap on the Me button.
segment.target: Pan the map away from the device location and then tap on the Me button.

segment.source: Verify that the map returns the phone location with the Me icon at the center.
segment.target: Verify that the map returns the phone location with the Me icon at the center.

segment.source: Tap the Scout button.
segment.target: Tap the Scout button.

segment.source: Verify that Local Scout loads within several seconds and the eat+drink pivot is displayed, with a list of businesses that offer food and drink.
segment.target: Verify that Local Scout loads within several seconds and the eat+drink pivot is displayed, with a list of businesses that offer food and drink.

segment.source: Verify that each item displayed in the eat+drink pivot includes the business name and address.
segment.target: Verify that each item displayed in the eat+drink pivot includes the business name and address.

segment.source: Verify that Scout loads with two other pivots, see+do and shop.
segment.target: Verify that Scout loads with two other pivots, see+do and shop.

segment.source: Return to the Map application, and then tap the Directions button.
segment.target: Return to the Map application, and then tap the Directions button.

segment.source: Leave the Start field defaulted to “my location.”
segment.target: Leave the Start field defaulted to “my location.”

segment.source: Tap on the End field and enter an end point (Seattle).
segment.target: Tap on the End field and enter an end point (Seattle).

segment.source: Press the enter key on the virtual keyboard to get the directions.
segment.target: Press the enter key on the virtual keyboard to get the directions.

segment.source: Verify that the step-by-step directions are shown in a list form, with a map stripe at the top.
segment.target: Verify that the step-by-step directions are shown in a list form, with a map stripe at the top.

segment.source: The Map should show an “A” at the start point.
segment.target: The Map should show an “A” at the start point.

segment.source: Scroll through the directions.
segment.target: Scroll through the directions.

segment.source: Verify that the map updates to show each new direction.
segment.target: Verify that the map updates to show each new direction.

segment.source: Scroll to the end.
segment.target: Scroll to the end.

segment.source: Verify that the map shows “B” at the end point.
segment.target: Verify that the map shows “B” at the end point.

segment.source: Return to the Map application.
segment.target: Return to the Map application.

segment.source: Tap the Search button.
segment.target: Tap the Search button.

segment.source: Enter the search term, “Restaurants in Seattle.”
segment.target: Enter the search term, “Restaurants in Seattle.”

segment.source: Tap the enter key on the virtual keyboard to execute the search.
segment.target: Tap the enter key on the virtual keyboard to execute the search.

segment.source: Verify that up to 10 search results are displayed as pins on the map, and the first pin is expanded so that you can see its name.
segment.target: Verify that up to 10 search results are displayed as pins on the map, and the first pin is expanded so that you can see its name.

segment.source: (The name may be cut off at the right edge).
segment.target: (The name may be cut off at the right edge).

segment.source: Lock Screen testing
segment.target: Lock Screen testing

segment.source: Prerequisites: None
segment.target: Prerequisites: None

segment.source: Test steps:
segment.target: Test steps:

segment.source: In the App list, tap SettingsPersonalizationLock screen.
segment.target: In the App list, tap SettingsPersonalizationLock screen.

segment.source: Set the “Screen times out after” field to “30 seconds.”
segment.target: Set the “Screen times out after” field to “30 seconds.”

segment.source: Leave the device idle for 30 seconds.
segment.target: Leave the device idle for 30 seconds.

segment.source: After the screen goes to sleep, press and swipe the screen to verify that nothing happens and that the device is locked.
segment.target: After the screen goes to sleep, press and swipe the screen to verify that nothing happens and that the device is locked.

segment.source: Press the Power button to unlock the device.
segment.target: Press the Power button to unlock the device.

segment.source: Swipe up to unlock the screen.
segment.target: Swipe up to unlock the screen.

segment.source: Verify that the device unlocked successfully.
segment.target: Verify that the device unlocked successfully.

segment.source: On the Lock Screen, turn the Password to “On.”
segment.target: On the Lock Screen, turn the Password to “On.”

segment.source: Create a password.
segment.target: Create a password.

segment.source: Leave the phone idle for 30 seconds.
segment.target: Leave the phone idle for 30 seconds.

segment.source: After the screen goes to sleep, press and swipe the screen to verify that nothing happens and the device is locked.
segment.target: After the screen goes to sleep, press and swipe the screen to verify that nothing happens and the device is locked.

segment.source: Press the Power button to unlock the device.
segment.target: Press the Power button to unlock the device.

segment.source: Swipe up to unlock the screen.
segment.target: Swipe up to unlock the screen.

segment.source: Verify that the prompt to enter password appears.
segment.target: Verify that the prompt to enter password appears.

segment.source: Enter an incorrect password.
segment.target: Enter an incorrect password.

segment.source: Verify that the device does not unlock and the correct password must be entered.
segment.target: Verify that the device does not unlock and the correct password must be entered.

segment.source: Enter the correct password.
segment.target: Enter the correct password.

segment.source: Verify that the device unlocks successfully.
segment.target: Verify that the device unlocks successfully.

segment.source: Capturing photos with the camera
segment.target: Capturing photos with the camera

segment.source: Prerequisites: None
segment.target: Prerequisites: None

segment.source: Test steps:
segment.target: Test steps:

segment.source: Lock the device and leave it idle to put it into Sleep Mode.
segment.target: Lock the device and leave it idle to put it into Sleep Mode.

segment.source: Press and hold the Camera hardware key to launch the camera.
segment.target: Press and hold the Camera hardware key to launch the camera.

segment.source: Then, verify that the camera launches either the default camera app or the camera app.
segment.target: Then, verify that the camera launches either the default camera app or the camera app.

segment.source: Tap Cancel in the Allow the camera to use your location screen.
segment.target: Tap Cancel in the Allow the camera to use your location screen.

segment.source: Note
segment.target: Note

segment.source: If the phone does not have a camera hardware button, launch the camera app directly.
segment.target: If the phone does not have a camera hardware button, launch the camera app directly.

segment.source: Note
segment.target: Note

segment.source: The “Allow…location” prompt will remember the previous settings and may not appear if the camera has been used recently.
segment.target: The “Allow…location” prompt will remember the previous settings and may not appear if the camera has been used recently.

segment.source: Verify that by default the camera is set to Picture mode.
segment.target: Verify that by default the camera is set to Picture mode.

segment.source: Pinch in and out with your fingers on the camera screen and verify that the camera screen zooms in and out.
segment.target: Pinch in and out with your fingers on the camera screen and verify that the camera screen zooms in and out.

segment.source: If your device has a camera hardware key, press and hold it half way and verify that a rectangular box is displayed on the screen for the auto-focus feature.
segment.target: If your device has a camera hardware key, press and hold it half way and verify that a rectangular box is displayed on the screen for the auto-focus feature.

segment.source: Also verify that an audible tone is heard when camera focus is complete.
segment.target: Also verify that an audible tone is heard when camera focus is complete.

segment.source: Tap on the screen or press the camera hardware button and verify that an audible tone is heard after taking a picture.
segment.target: Tap on the screen or press the camera hardware button and verify that an audible tone is heard after taking a picture.

segment.source: Swipe left to review the picture that you just took and examine for the following.
segment.target: Swipe left to review the picture that you just took and examine for the following.

segment.source: Color errors.
segment.target: Color errors.

segment.source: Dust under the camera window.
segment.target: Dust under the camera window.

segment.source: You will notice this if there are darker areas in the photo.
segment.target: You will notice this if there are darker areas in the photo.

segment.source: Blurry images
segment.target: Blurry images

segment.source: An excessively bright or dull image.
segment.target: An excessively bright or dull image.

segment.source: This suggests that something is wrong with the camera sensor.
segment.target: This suggests that something is wrong with the camera sensor.

segment.source: Recording videos with the camera
segment.target: Recording videos with the camera

segment.source: Prerequisites: None
segment.target: Prerequisites: None

segment.source: Test steps:
segment.target: Test steps:

segment.source: Lock the device and leave it idle to put it into Sleep Mode.
segment.target: Lock the device and leave it idle to put it into Sleep Mode.

segment.source: Press and hold the Camera hardware key to launch the camera or launch the app directly from the Apps list.
segment.target: Press and hold the Camera hardware key to launch the camera or launch the app directly from the Apps list.

segment.source: Tap Cancel in the Allow the camera to use your location screen.
segment.target: Tap Cancel in the Allow the camera to use your location screen.

segment.source: Note
segment.target: Note

segment.source: If the device does not have a camera hardware button, launch the camera app directly.
segment.target: If the device does not have a camera hardware button, launch the camera app directly.

segment.source: Note
segment.target: Note

segment.source: The “Allow…location” prompt will remember previous settings and may not appear if the camera has been used recently.
segment.target: The “Allow…location” prompt will remember previous settings and may not appear if the camera has been used recently.

segment.source: Change to video capture mode.
segment.target: Change to video capture mode.

segment.source: Pinch in and out with fingers on the screen and verify that the camera screen zooms in and out.
segment.target: Pinch in and out with fingers on the screen and verify that the camera screen zooms in and out.

segment.source: If the device has a camera hardware button, press it to start recording a video.
segment.target: If the device has a camera hardware button, press it to start recording a video.

segment.source: Verify that there is a beep alert and the counter for the recording starts.
segment.target: Verify that there is a beep alert and the counter for the recording starts.

segment.source: If the device has a camera hardware button, press it again to stop recording video after 15 seconds.
segment.target: If the device has a camera hardware button, press it again to stop recording video after 15 seconds.

segment.source: Swipe left on the camera screen and press Play on the captured video.
segment.target: Swipe left on the camera screen and press Play on the captured video.

segment.source: Verify that the video is captured properly and plays for 15 seconds.
segment.target: Verify that the video is captured properly and plays for 15 seconds.

segment.source: Calling with a Bluetooth device
segment.target: Calling with a Bluetooth device

segment.source: Prerequisites:
segment.target: Prerequisites:

segment.source: Bluetooth device to connect to the test device
segment.target: Bluetooth device to connect to the test device

segment.source: Second phone to test call functionality.
segment.target: Second phone to test call functionality.

segment.source: Test steps:
segment.target: Test steps:

segment.source: In the App list, tap SettingsDevicesBluetooth, Turn Bluetooth on.
segment.target: In the App list, tap SettingsDevicesBluetooth, Turn Bluetooth on.

segment.source: Connect/pair a Bluetooth device with the test device
segment.target: Connect/pair a Bluetooth device with the test device

segment.source: Call the test device
segment.target: Call the test device

segment.source: Verify that the call appears on the test device with an on-screen notice.
segment.target: Verify that the call appears on the test device with an on-screen notice.

segment.source: Verify that the call ringtone can be heard through the Bluetooth device that is connected with the test device
segment.target: Verify that the call ringtone can be heard through the Bluetooth device that is connected with the test device

segment.source: Answer the call on the test device using the connected Bluetooth device.
segment.target: Answer the call on the test device using the connected Bluetooth device.

segment.source: Verify that the audio from the second device can be heard on the test device through the Bluetooth device.
segment.target: Verify that the audio from the second device can be heard on the test device through the Bluetooth device.

segment.source: Verify that the audio from the test device through the Bluetooth device can be heard on the second device.
segment.target: Verify that the audio from the test device through the Bluetooth device can be heard on the second device.

segment.source: End the call using the Bluetooth device.
segment.target: End the call using the Bluetooth device.

segment.source: Bluetooth and NFC (Tap+Send)
segment.target: Bluetooth and NFC (Tap+Send)

segment.source: Prerequisites:
segment.target: Prerequisites:

segment.source: Bluetooth must be turned on.
segment.target: Bluetooth must be turned on.

segment.source: Second phone to verify tap+send functionality.
segment.target: Second phone to verify tap+send functionality.

segment.source: Test steps:
segment.target: Test steps:

segment.source: Go to PhotosAlbums and select a photo.
segment.target: Go to PhotosAlbums and select a photo.

segment.source: Select the options for the Photo.
segment.target: Select the options for the Photo.

segment.source: Share the photo through NFC/Tap+send.
segment.target: Share the photo through NFC/Tap+send.

segment.source: A pop-up screen for transfer will appear on the second device.
segment.target: A pop-up screen for transfer will appear on the second device.

segment.source: Tap Accept and wait for the transfer to finish.
segment.target: Tap Accept and wait for the transfer to finish.

segment.source: Go to PhotosAlbumsSaved Pictures.
segment.target: Go to PhotosAlbumsSaved Pictures.

segment.source: Verify that the transferred photo appears in the album.
segment.target: Verify that the transferred photo appears in the album.

segment.source: Proximity Sensor
segment.target: Proximity Sensor

segment.source: Prerequisites: None
segment.target: Prerequisites: None

segment.source: Test steps:
segment.target: Test steps:

segment.source: On the Start screen, tap Phone.
segment.target: On the Start screen, tap Phone.

segment.source: Make a call to the second device
segment.target: Make a call to the second device

segment.source: Put your finger over the earpiece area.
segment.target: Put your finger over the earpiece area.

segment.source: Verify that the display turns off.
segment.target: Verify that the display turns off.

segment.source: Disconnect the call.

segment.source: Video streaming
segment.target: Video streaming

segment.source: Prerequisites:
segment.target: Prerequisites:

segment.source: The device must be connected to Wi-Fi or have an internet connection to use the web browser.
segment.target: The device must be connected to Wi-Fi or have an internet connection to use the web browser.

segment.source: A second device to call with.
segment.target: A second device to call with.

segment.source: A Bluetooth device.
segment.target: A Bluetooth device.

segment.source: Test steps:
segment.target: Test steps:

segment.source: On the Start screen, tap Internet Explorer.
segment.target: On the Start screen, tap Internet Explorer.

segment.source: Note
segment.target: Note

segment.source: When the browser is launched for the first time, a dialog will pop up asking to Use recommended settings?
segment.target: When the browser is launched for the first time, a dialog will pop up asking to Use recommended settings?

segment.source: Tap the Recommended button.
segment.target: Tap the Recommended button.

segment.source: Tap the address bar and go to a website that supports videos.
segment.target: Tap the address bar and go to a website that supports videos.

segment.source: Select a video from the website and tap play.
segment.target: Select a video from the website and tap play.

segment.source: Verify that the video starts buffering and eventually starts playing.
segment.target: Verify that the video starts buffering and eventually starts playing.

segment.source: Depending on the network connection speed, it may take 15-20 seconds for the video to start playing.
segment.target: Depending on the network connection speed, it may take 15-20 seconds for the video to start playing.

segment.source: Tap the Pause button on the video screen.
segment.target: Tap the Pause button on the video screen.

segment.source: Verify that the video is paused.
segment.target: Verify that the video is paused.

segment.source: Tap the Play button on the video screen.
segment.target: Tap the Play button on the video screen.

segment.source: Verify that the video resumes and plays without any problems.
segment.target: Verify that the video resumes and plays without any problems.

segment.source: Verify that an alert for the incoming call is heard over Bluetooth and the audio stops playing.
segment.target: Verify that an alert for the incoming call is heard over Bluetooth and the audio stops playing.

segment.source: Receive the incoming call by pressing the Bluetooth button, and verify that the call connects.
segment.target: Receive the incoming call by pressing the Bluetooth button, and verify that the call connects.

segment.source: Disconnect the call through Bluetooth and tap the Play button on the video screen.
segment.target: Disconnect the call through Bluetooth and tap the Play button on the video screen.

segment.source: Verify that the video starts playing and the audio is routed through the Bluetooth device.
segment.target: Verify that the video starts playing and the audio is routed through the Bluetooth device.

segment.source: From the second device, send a text message to the test device.
segment.target: From the second device, send a text message to the test device.

segment.source: Verify that a text notification on the phone and an audio notification on the Bluetooth for the incoming message is received.
segment.target: Verify that a text notification on the phone and an audio notification on the Bluetooth for the incoming message is received.

segment.source: Tap Ignore to ignore the text message.
segment.target: Tap Ignore to ignore the text message.

segment.source: Note
segment.target: Note

segment.source: For some regions, speech is not supported, and a message is displayed on the device.
segment.target: For some regions, speech is not supported, and a message is displayed on the device.

segment.source: Tap Close and proceed with the testing.
segment.target: Tap Close and proceed with the testing.

segment.source: Tap the Play button on the video screen.
segment.target: Tap the Play button on the video screen.

segment.source: Verify that the video starts playing without any problems and that the audio is routed through Bluetooth.
segment.target: Verify that the video starts playing without any problems and that the audio is routed through Bluetooth.

segment.source: Audio streaming
segment.target: Audio streaming

segment.source: Prerequisites:
segment.target: Prerequisites:

segment.source: Second device for call support.
segment.target: Second device for call support.

segment.source: An A2DP Bluetooth device.
segment.target: An A2DP Bluetooth device.

segment.source: Desi Music app downloaded.
segment.target: Desi Music app downloaded.

segment.source: Test steps:
segment.target: Test steps:

segment.source: Sign in using your Microsoft Account.
segment.target: Sign in using your Microsoft Account.

segment.source: In the App list, tap SettingsDevicesBluetooth.
segment.target: In the App list, tap SettingsDevicesBluetooth.

segment.source: Turn Bluetooth on.
segment.target: Turn Bluetooth on.

segment.source: Put an A2DP Bluetooth device in paring mode.
segment.target: Put an A2DP Bluetooth device in paring mode.

segment.source: When it is listed on the search results on the device, tap on it.
segment.target: When it is listed on the search results on the device, tap on it.

segment.source: Verify that the status of the Bluetooth device shows as “Connected Voice Music.”
segment.target: Verify that the status of the Bluetooth device shows as “Connected Voice Music.”

segment.source: Press the hardware back button to return to the App list.
segment.target: Press the hardware back button to return to the App list.

segment.source: Tap on the “Desi Music” app.
segment.target: Tap on the “Desi Music” app.

segment.source: Swipe left to the New pivot and tap on an album.
segment.target: Swipe left to the New pivot and tap on an album.

segment.source: Tap on one of the tracks of the album.
segment.target: Tap on one of the tracks of the album.

segment.source: Verify that the track starts buffering and eventually starts playing over Bluetooth.
segment.target: Verify that the track starts buffering and eventually starts playing over Bluetooth.

segment.source: Depending on the network connection speed, it may take up to 15-20 seconds for the audio to start playing.
segment.target: Depending on the network connection speed, it may take up to 15-20 seconds for the audio to start playing.

segment.source: From the second device, make a call to the test device.
segment.target: From the second device, make a call to the test device.

segment.source: Verify that an alert for the incoming call is heard over Bluetooth and the audio pauses.
segment.target: Verify that an alert for the incoming call is heard over Bluetooth and the audio pauses.

segment.source: Receive the incoming call using the Bluetooth button.
segment.target: Receive the incoming call using the Bluetooth button.

segment.source: Verify that the call connects.
segment.target: Verify that the call connects.

segment.source: Disconnect the call through the Bluetooth device.
segment.target: Disconnect the call through the Bluetooth device.

segment.source: Verify that the track resumes automatically.
segment.target: Verify that the track resumes automatically.

segment.source: From the second device, send a text message to the test device.
segment.target: From the second device, send a text message to the test device.

segment.source: Verify that a text notification is displayed on the device and an audio notification is received on the Bluetooth device for the incoming message.
segment.target: Verify that a text notification is displayed on the device and an audio notification is received on the Bluetooth device for the incoming message.

segment.source: Tap on the text notification and send a response.
segment.target: Tap on the text notification and send a response.

segment.source: Verify that the audio continues to play without any problems.
segment.target: Verify that the audio continues to play without any problems.

segment.source: Tap twice on the Bluetooth Back button.
segment.target: Tap twice on the Bluetooth Back button.

segment.source: Press the Bluetooth Forward button.
segment.target: Press the Bluetooth Forward button.

segment.source: Verify that the next track starts playing.
segment.target: Verify that the next track starts playing.

segment.source: Press the Bluetooth Rewind button.
segment.target: Press the Bluetooth Rewind button.

segment.source: Verify that the previous track starts playing.
segment.target: Verify that the previous track starts playing.

segment.source: Press the Bluetooth Pause button.
segment.target: Press the Bluetooth Pause button.

segment.source: Verify that the track pauses.
segment.target: Verify that the track pauses.

segment.source: Press the Bluetooth Pause button again.
segment.target: Press the Bluetooth Pause button again.

segment.source: Verify that the track resumes playing.
segment.target: Verify that the track resumes playing.

segment.source: SMS/MMS Messaging
segment.target: SMS/MMS Messaging

segment.source: Prerequisites:
segment.target: Prerequisites:

segment.source: Two extra device to test the messaging services.
segment.target: Two extra device to test the messaging services.

segment.source: Have a photograph and a video on the devices
segment.target: Have a photograph and a video on the devices

segment.source: Test steps:
segment.target: Test steps:

segment.source: On the Start screen, tap Messaging, and then tap New.
segment.target: On the Start screen, tap Messaging, and then tap New.

segment.source: Create a new text message.
segment.target: Create a new text message.

segment.source: Verify that the chat card is opened with an empty address bar and reply box.
segment.target: Verify that the chat card is opened with an empty address bar and reply box.

segment.source: Type the phone number of the second device in the “To” field.
segment.target: Type the phone number of the second device in the “To” field.

segment.source: Type a short text Hello into the reply box and send the message.
segment.target: Type a short text Hello into the reply box and send the message.

segment.source: Verify that the sent message shows up in the chat card.
segment.target: Verify that the sent message shows up in the chat card.

segment.source: Verify that the second device received the message successfully.
segment.target: Verify that the second device received the message successfully.

segment.source: On the chat card, tap Attachment button and choose to attach a picture.
segment.target: On the chat card, tap Attachment button and choose to attach a picture.

segment.source: Select a picture from the camera roll and then send the message.
segment.target: Select a picture from the camera roll and then send the message.

segment.source: Verify that the second device receives the picture successfully.
segment.target: Verify that the second device receives the picture successfully.

segment.source: Reply from the second device with a picture attachment.
segment.target: Reply from the second device with a picture attachment.

segment.source: Verify that the test device receives the picture message.
segment.target: Verify that the test device receives the picture message.

segment.source: Reply from the test device with a video attachment.
segment.target: Reply from the test device with a video attachment.

segment.source: Verify that the second device receives and can play the video.
segment.target: Verify that the second device receives and can play the video.

segment.source: Reply from the second device with a video attachment.
segment.target: Reply from the second device with a video attachment.

segment.source: Verify that the test device receives the video and can play it.
segment.target: Verify that the test device receives the video and can play it.

segment.source: On the test device, press the hardware back button and create another SMS message.
segment.target: On the test device, press the hardware back button and create another SMS message.

segment.source: Verify that the chat card is opened and has an empty address bar and reply box.
segment.target: Verify that the chat card is opened and has an empty address bar and reply box.

segment.source: Type one phone number, then enter a semicolon, and type another contact’s phone number into the “To” field.
segment.target: Type one phone number, then enter a semicolon, and type another contact’s phone number into the “To” field.

segment.source: Type a message with more than 320 characters into the reply box and tap Send.
segment.target: Type a message with more than 320 characters into the reply box and tap Send.

segment.source: Verify that the character counter appears before or when the character limit is reached.
segment.target: Verify that the character counter appears before or when the character limit is reached.

segment.source: Verify that the sent message shows up in a chat card.
segment.target: Verify that the sent message shows up in a chat card.

segment.source: Verify that the multi-part SMS message is received successfully on the second and third devices
segment.target: Verify that the multi-part SMS message is received successfully on the second and third devices

segment.source: Send an SMS reply message from either the second or the third device to the test device.
segment.target: Send an SMS reply message from either the second or the third device to the test device.

segment.source: Verify on the test device that the audio notification is heard for the incoming SMS message.
segment.target: Verify on the test device that the audio notification is heard for the incoming SMS message.

segment.source: Verify that the reply shows up in a chat card as the latest message.
segment.target: Verify that the reply shows up in a chat card as the latest message.

segment.source: Tap the Lens button.
segment.target: Tap the Lens button.

segment.source: Verify that the Lens overlay appears with the Bing Vision icon and icons for any installed lenses.
segment.target: Verify that the Lens overlay appears with the Bing Vision icon and icons for any installed lenses.

segment.source: Select one of the installed lenses.
segment.target: Select one of the installed lenses.

segment.source: If no lens applications have been installed, you will need to download one.
segment.target: If no lens applications have been installed, you will need to download one.

segment.source: Select “find more lenses”
segment.target: Select “find more lenses”

segment.source: Select and install an application from the list.
segment.target: Select and install an application from the list.

segment.source: Verify that you can take a picture using the installed lens application.
segment.target: Verify that you can take a picture using the installed lens application.

segment.source: Verify that the picture is shown and that you can scroll between recent pictures and the camera.
segment.target: Verify that the picture is shown and that you can scroll between recent pictures and the camera.

segment.source: Select a recent picture.
segment.target: Select a recent picture.

segment.source: Verify that you can share the photo using NFC/Tap+Share.
segment.target: Verify that you can share the photo using NFC/Tap+Share.

segment.source: Local scout load time
segment.target: Local scout load time

segment.source: Prerequisites: None
segment.target: Prerequisites: None

segment.source: Test steps:
segment.target: Test steps:

segment.source: Launch Local Scout.
segment.target: Launch Local Scout.

segment.source: If you are launching Local Scout for the first time, allow access to your current location.
segment.target: If you are launching Local Scout for the first time, allow access to your current location.

segment.source: Verify that you are able to see various tabs for different types of local establishments.
segment.target: Verify that you are able to see various tabs for different types of local establishments.

segment.source: Select a restaurant.
segment.target: Select a restaurant.

segment.source: Verify that the appropriate information for a restaurant is provided.
segment.target: Verify that the appropriate information for a restaurant is provided.

segment.source: Select the directions.
segment.target: Select the directions.

segment.source: Verify that the map loads with directions to the restaurant.
segment.target: Verify that the map loads with directions to the restaurant.

segment.source: Verify that Local Scout loads locations/results in an acceptable amount of time.
segment.target: Verify that Local Scout loads locations/results in an acceptable amount of time.

segment.source: Download maps
segment.target: Download maps

segment.source: Prerequisites:
segment.target: Prerequisites:

segment.source: Connected to Wi-Fi to download maps.
segment.target: Connected to Wi-Fi to download maps.

segment.source: Test steps:
segment.target: Test steps:

segment.source: In the App list, tap MapsMore (…)Settings.
segment.target: In the App list, tap MapsMore (…)Settings.

segment.source: Note
segment.target: Note

segment.source: If the application is launched for the first time, the app will ask for permission to access the phone location.
segment.target: If the application is launched for the first time, the app will ask for permission to access the phone location.

segment.source: Allow location access.
segment.target: Allow location access.

segment.source: Select download maps.
segment.target: Select download maps.

segment.source: Tap the Add (+) button.
segment.target: Tap the Add (+) button.

segment.source: Select North and Central AmericaUSAIndiana.
segment.target: Select North and Central AmericaUSAIndiana.

segment.source: Wait for the map to finish downloading.
segment.target: Wait for the map to finish downloading.

segment.source: Press Start to return to the Start screen.
segment.target: Press Start to return to the Start screen.

segment.source: In the App list, tap SettingsAirplane ModeTurn On.
segment.target: In the App list, tap SettingsAirplane ModeTurn On.

segment.source: Press Start, then in the App list, tap Maps.
segment.target: Press Start, then in the App list, tap Maps.

segment.source: Tap Search (magnifying glass) and search for “Butte, Montana”.
segment.target: Tap Search (magnifying glass) and search for “Butte, Montana”.

segment.source: Verify that Butte, Montana cannot be found in the downloaded maps.
segment.target: Verify that Butte, Montana cannot be found in the downloaded maps.

segment.source: Search for “Indianapolis, Indiana”.
segment.target: Search for “Indianapolis, Indiana”.

segment.source: Verify that the map loads the downloaded map of Indianapolis, Indiana.
segment.target: Verify that the map loads the downloaded map of Indianapolis, Indiana.

segment.source: Visual Voicemail
segment.target: Visual Voicemail

segment.source: Prerequisites:
segment.target: Prerequisites:

segment.source: You will need a second device.
segment.target: You will need a second device.

segment.source: Test steps:
segment.target: Test steps:

segment.source: Power off the test device
segment.target: Power off the test device

segment.source: Call the test device using the second device.
segment.target: Call the test device using the second device.

segment.source: Verify that the call goes to voice mail.
segment.target: Verify that the call goes to voice mail.

segment.source: Leave a voice mail.
segment.target: Leave a voice mail.

segment.source: Power on the test device.
segment.target: Power on the test device.

segment.source: Tap Phone.
segment.target: Tap Phone.

segment.source: Tap the voicemail icon.
segment.target: Tap the voicemail icon.

segment.source: Accept the Visual Voicemail client setup.
segment.target: Accept the Visual Voicemail client setup.

segment.source: Verify that the voice mail is downloaded after setup, and that you can listen to the voice mail.
segment.target: Verify that the voice mail is downloaded after setup, and that you can listen to the voice mail.

segment.source: Call the test device from the second device again.
segment.target: Call the test device from the second device again.

segment.source: Do not answer it.
segment.target: Do not answer it.

segment.source: Verify that the call goes to voice mail.
segment.target: Verify that the call goes to voice mail.

segment.source: Leave a message.
segment.target: Leave a message.

segment.source: Verify that you receive an SMS message that indicates that a voice mail is available.
segment.target: Verify that you receive an SMS message that indicates that a voice mail is available.

segment.source: Verify that the new voice mail is listed and that you can listen to the voice mail.
segment.target: Verify that the new voice mail is listed and that you can listen to the voice mail.

segment.source: Repeat steps 9-10 and leave a second voice message.
segment.target: Repeat steps 9-10 and leave a second voice message.

segment.source: Verify that an icon shows two voice mails listed.
segment.target: Verify that an icon shows two voice mails listed.

segment.source: Play the voice mails.
segment.target: Play the voice mails.

segment.source: Delete the voice mails.
segment.target: Delete the voice mails.

segment.target: Prerequisites:

segment.target: Test steps:

segment.target: Verify that the device displays the number of Guests (second device) connected to shared Wi-Fi.
